column1: A country is different from an individual in the fact that there are certain expenses that are not exactly necessary
column2: and yet which must be provided for
column3: for the honor of the country. A man who is in money difficulties can cut down his expenses to the mere cost of food
column5: and clothes. In this way a man is better off than a country. But
column7: a man can only earn just so much money; he cannot force people to buy his goods
column8: or pay him better prices; he has to do the best he can with what he can earn; while a country can
column10: force people to give it the money it needs
column11: and so it is better off than an individual.Some of the expenses of a country that must be met are the salaries of all the officers who preserve law and order
column15: and the police; the pensions of the old soldiers
column16: and of their families; the building of forts and warships
column17: and of the guns to arm them; the making and issuing of money
column18: and the handling and delivering of letters.
